remarks: If two real numbers are less than a third real number, the sum of the two real numbers is less then twice the third real number.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
lt2addmuld.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR ) $.
lt2addmuld.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
lt2addmuld.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. RR ) $.
lt2addmuld.altc $e |- ( ph -> A < C ) $.
lt2addmuld.bltc $e |- ( ph -> B < C ) $.
lt2addmuld $p |- ( ph -> ( A + B ) < ( 2 x. C ) ) $.
